metadata.name: Go Fish
metadata.author: Card Game Engine
metadata.description: Classic card matching game for 2-4 players. Ask opponents for cards to make sets of four.

cards.note: Standard 52-card deck. Each rank has 4 cards (one per suit).

instructions.overview: Collect sets of four matching cards (all four suits of the same rank). Ask other players for cards you need. If they don't have it, 'Go Fish' from the deck!
setup: Choose number of players (2-4) and how many are CPU opponents
Each player is dealt 5 cards (2-3 players) or 4 cards (4 players)
Remaining cards form the draw pile (fishing pond)
Players examine their hands and any complete sets of 4 are placed down immediately
gameplay: On your turn, ask any opponent for a specific rank (e.g., 'Do you have any 7s?')
You must have at least one card of that rank in your hand to ask
If opponent has cards of that rank, they give you ALL of them
You can continue asking (same or different player/rank) as long as you get cards
If opponent doesn't have the rank, they say 'Go Fish!' and you draw from the pond
If you draw the rank you asked for, you get another turn
When you collect all 4 cards of a rank, place them down as a set (counts as 1 point)
Turn passes to next player when you don't get cards or pond is empty
CPU opponents use smart AI to remember which cards were asked for
instructions.winning: Game ends when all 13 sets are made. Player with the most sets wins!

examples.title: Successful Ask
examples.description: You have a 7 of Hearts. You ask CPU 1 for 7s. CPU 1 has 7 of Diamonds and 7 of Clubs and gives both to you.

examples.title: Complete Set
examples.description: You now have all four 7s and place them down for 1 point.

examples.title: Go Fish
examples.description: You ask for Queens but opponent has none. You draw from pond.
